a situation in which someone dies without leaving instructions about who should be given their property: If you die without a will your estate is subject to the rules of intestacy. The intestacy laws can be particularly harsh for unmarried couples. You will need to provide details of how the estate was passed, including intestacies and assets passing by survivorship. More examplesFewer examplesIn the case of a partial intestacy, the will does not provide for the disposal of the entire estate. If you die without making a will, you die intestate and intestacy rules apply.
